title: Public transport for the NRL Round 3 –  Melbourne Storm v Penrith Panthers: Thursday 20 March 2025
articleContent:
Last year’s grand finalists meet in Round 3 of the NRL Season when Melbourne Storm hosts the Penrith Panthers!

Public transport is your best way to enjoy the action and we're running extra services to help you get home from AAMI Park on Thursday 20 March.

Kick-off is at 8pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner. Check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Please note the following disruptions on Thursday 20 March:

  • Hurstbridge line - buses replace trains between Heidelberg and Eltham
  • Werribee line - buses replace trains between Newport and Werribee

 Metropolitan train

Return trains from Richmond Station

  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 10:10pm from Platform 10
  • Ringwood – leaving at 10:10pm from Platform 9
  • Sandringham – leaving at 10:16pm from Platform 2
  • Frankston – leaving at 10:12pm from Platform 4
  • Westall – leaving at 10:08pm from Platform 6

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Extra Route 70 trams run between Stop 4 Flinders Street/Elizabeth Street and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

 Metropolitan bus

Getting to and from Flemington Racecourse

Catch a Route 246 bus close to the MCG.

Note: the last bus may depart prior to the end of the event. 

 Regional train

Normal trains leave from Southern Cross Station.
